courses.subject: MEDP
courses.title: Molecular Medicine

meetings.instructor:
Professor JIANG Peiyong, 
Professor WANG Haitian, 
Professor WANG Huating

Professor JIANG Peiyong, 
Professor WANG Haitian, 
Professor WANG Huating

courses.description: This joint course will give an introduction to basic concepts as well as modern techniques and technologies in Molecular Medicine.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For research postgraduate students in Faculty of Medicine (Except Division of Nursing)
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. To obtain basic knowledge of chromosomal abnormalities in tumour cells, methods for detection and their clinical significance
2. To discuss the genetic basis of cancer and implications for clinical diagnosis, prognostication and disease monitoring
3. Special topics in neuroscience/cancer biology: to focus on neuronal signaling and neurodegenerative diseases, and cell cycle control
4. Cell signaling: to discuss the concept and techniques used in signal transduction study and its connection with cancer
5. To obtain basic knowledge in molecular diagnostics
6. To obtain basic concepts on the design of molecular medicine studies, including statistical considerations
7. To obtain basic knowledge on high throughput molecular technologies, including those used in proteomics and the mass spectrometric analysis of nucleic acids
courses.course_syllabus: Current usages of molecular diagnostic tests will be discussed and cancer will be used as a disease model in most of the examples covered in the course. Specific course objectives in relation to the topics covered are as follows: To obtain basic knowledge of chromosomal abnormalities in tumour cells, methods for detection and their clinical significance To discuss the genetic basis of cancer and implications for clinical diagnosis, prognostication and disease monitoring Special topics in neuroscience/cancer biology: to focus on neuronal signaling and neurodegenerative diseases, and cell cycle control Cell signaling: to discuss the concept and techniques used in signal transduction study ad its connection with cancer To obtain basic knowledge in molecular diagnostics To obtain basic concepts on the design of molecular medicine studies, including statistical considerations To obtain basic knowledge on high throughput molecular technologies, including those used in proteomics and the mass spectrometric analysis of nucleic acids.
courses.feedback_evaluation: "Student Opinion Survey on Courses offered under the Joint Centre for Advanced Study (JCAS)" will be conducted at the term end for the course.
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the course outline provided by course teacher.
courses.recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be suggested by the respective teacher during the lectures.

courses.description: This course covers descriptive statistics, graphical methods, probability, probability distributions (normal, binomial and Poisson), sampling error, confidence intervals and basic hypothesis testing methods including the t-tests and chi-square tests.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For research postgraduate students in Faculty of Medicine (Except Division of Nursing)
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students should be able to:
1. Comprehend basic biostatistics appearing in medical literature
2. Conduct basic biostatistics analysis including summary statistics and tests by the SPSS
3. Write concise reports and interpretation of basic biostatistics analysis results
courses.course_syllabus:
This course will cover below topics:

* Exploration of data and probability distributions
* Population, sampling and confidence Intervals
* Hypothesis testing I
* Hypothesis testing II

courses.description: This course covers ANOVA methods including one-way, two-way and repeated measures ANOVA, non-parametric hypothesis testing methods, correlation, linear regression and logistic regression.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For research postgraduate students in Faculty of Medicine (Except Division of Nursing)
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students should be able to:
1. Comprehend basic biostatistics appearing in medical literature
2. Conduct basic biostatistics analysis including summary statistics and tests by the SPSS
3. Write concise reports and interpretation of basic biostatistics analysis results
courses.course_syllabus:
This course will cover below topics:

* ANOVA I
* ANOVA II / Nonparametric tests
* Correlation / Linear regression I
* Linear regression II / Logistic Regression
courses.recommended_readings: Dawson and Trapp, Basic and Clinical Biostatistics, Lange 4th edition
